title: Real Madrid 'join Barcelona in race to sign Bayer Leverkusen midfielder Kai Havertz'
text:
Real Madrid have joined rivals Barcelona in the race to sign Bayer Leverkusen wonderkid Kai Havertz, according to Mundo Deportivo.

Havertz has been making waves in the Bundesliga and recently scored his first international goal for Germany in their 2-2 draw with Argentina.

The attacking midfielder's contract at Bayer Leverkusen runs until June 2020 with Manchester United, Chelsea and Arsenal also circling around Havertz for his signature - that is valued at no less than £88million.

Kai Havertz is in the final year of his contract at Leverkusen and has been at the club since 2016

Real Madrid are keeping an eye on the 20-year-old to potentially add some youth to their star-studded midfield ranks. Zinedine Zidane has been pleased with the progress that Federico Valverde has made at the Bernabeu but with Luka Modric recently turning 34, looking to the future is in Zidane's and the club's best interest.

However, Los Blancos have also been linked with Manchester United's Paul Pogba and Tottenham's Christian Eriksen - with the latter potentially available at a much cheaper price.

Their La Liga rivals Barcelona have been tracking Havertz for several months and enquired about his price tag in the summer - and got a response from the German club requesting £70m.

Real Madrid and Barcelona are interested in signing Havertz, who has impressed in Germany

Barcelona and Madrid have ageing midfielders and Havertz would make a good replacement

The midfielder would seem to be a logical and exciting successor to Ivan Rakitic, who looks destined for the exit door after venting his frustration at falling out of favour to Frenkie de Jong in Barcelona's midfield.

Premier League clubs Manchester United, Chelsea and Arsenal are also in the race to sign the German whose style of play has been compared to Mesut Ozil.

Havertz made his Bundesliga debut at 17 years old and became the youngest ever player to reach 50 appearances, breaking Timo Werner's record.
description: Kai Havertz is one of the hottest prospects in European football with over 100 senior appearances at 20 years old. Real Madrid have joined several clubs who are interested in midfielder
